intro: Paratropia gracilis, commonly known as the slender paratropia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Paratropia gracilis is typically found in moist, open habitats such as swamps and wet meadows.
